newsitem.title: USA: Specialty Paperboard buys two companies.
newsitem.headline: Specialty Paperboard buys two companies.

text.p: Specialty Paperboard Inc said Thursday it had signed definitive agreements to buy Custom Papers Group Inc and Arcon Coating Mills Inc.
Both Custom Papers and Arcon Coating specialize in paper products.
Terms were not disclosed and company officials could not be reached for comment.
"Combined, they (the companies) will effectively double the gross revenues of our company," Specialty Paperboard said. "They will also give us strong positions in several new specialty markets."
It said it would finance the acquisitions through a public offering of senior notes, with closings for both transactions by the end of the third quarter.

Custom Papers is a $95 million wholly-owned subsidiary of CPG Investors Inc. It makes filters for internal combustion engines and other industrial products at five paper mills in Massachusetts, Michigan and New Jersey.
Arcon Coating has annual revenues totalling some $28 million. It makes colored binding and stripping tapes for offices, among other products.
Specialty Paperboard makes heavyweight pressboard used in office and school products such as binders and file folders.
